page.title: 13BRIDGE END HALL
page.content: 36 YEARS AGO THE HALL WAS BUILT IN BRIDGE END.IT WAS BUILT BY CHARLIE SMITH FROM YELL AND OPENED IN 1949. .AN EXTENSION WAS BUILT ON IT IN 1981 WITH GRANTS FROM THE SCOTTISH EDUCATION DEPT AND THE COUNCIL AS WELL AS MONEY RAISED LOCALLY.NOW IT IS USED QUITE OFTEN.GROUPS THAT MEET REGULARLY ARE BROWNIES ON WEDNESDAY, YOUTH CLUB ON FRIDAY AND SCOTTISH WOMENS RURAL INSTITUTE ONCE A MONTH.THE BOYS BRIGADE ARE PLANNING TO MEET THERE NEXT YEAR.OCCASIONAL EVENTS ARE DANCES, WEDDINGS AND EXHIBITIONS. IN THE SUMMER LOCAL WOMEN RUN SUMMER TEAS TO RAISE MONEY FOR VARIOUS CHARITIES AND THE CHILDRENS CHRISTMAS PARTIES AS WELL AS HALL FUNDS.THREE ANNUAL EVENTS ARE A GUY FAWKES NIGHT WITH FIREWORKS AND A DANCE AFTERWARDS, THE LOCAL CHILDRENS' CHRISTMAS PARTY AND THE SCALLOWAY FIRE FESTIVAL DANCE.
